links.*: The Lost Road and Other Writings

wikitext.*:
'''AWA''' is a [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme|root]] signifying "away, forth; out"<ref name=Ety>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 349 (form appearing as "AWA-")</ref> or "go, move (from speaker), go away, depart", "go, depart, pass away; go away".<ref name=Eldarin>{{PE|Eldarin}}, p. 148 (form appearing as "√AWA, WĀ")</ref> Its meaning is also given as referring to "movement away, viewed from the point of view of the thing, person, or place left" or "away from the speaker or the place of his thought".<ref name=WJ>{{WJ|A}}, pp. 360f., 364-7 (form appearing as "*AWA")</ref>

==Derivatives==

*[[Common Eldarin]]: ''au-''; ''awā''<ref name=WJ/>

*[[Quenya]]: ''[[auta-|auta]]'';<ref name=Eldarin/><ref name=WJ/> ''ava'' ("outside, beyond");<ref name=Ety/><ref name=VT>{{VT|45a}}, p. 6</ref> ''öa, öar'';<ref name=WJ/> ''aukiri'' ("cut of, so that a portion is lost or no longer available")<ref name=WJ/>
*[[Sindarin]] ''[[gwaen]]''<ref name=Eldarin/>
*[[Telerin]]: ''au-, avad''; ''auta-''; ''[[vanua]]''<ref name=WJ/>

*[[Noldorin]]: ''ar-''<ref name=Ety/><ref name=VT/>

==Other versions of the legendarium==

In the ''Qenya Lexicon'' appears the root AVA-, signifying "go away, depart, leave".<ref>{{PE|12}}</ref>
